intro: Paraphlomis biflora, commonly known as the twin-flowered blueweed, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to parts of Asia, including China, India, and Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which is known for its aromatic plants and medicinal properties. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest floors or stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a distinctive blue-green color, while its small, pale blue flowers bloom in clusters. Paraphlomis biflora has been traditionally used in herbal medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and antispasmodic properties.
